abstract.p: Letter by Richard W Mueller, head of Northfield Mount Hermon School in Massachusetts, explains efforts to assure student safety in dormitories

block.p: Re ''After Dormitory Attacks, Boarding Schools Move to Reduce Risks'' (news article, June 17):

Re ''After Dormitory Attacks, Boarding Schools Move to Reduce Risks'' (news article, June 17):
Let no one believe that these challenges are unique to boarding schools. They are symptomatic of a larger cultural issue.
The isolated incident described was contrary to everything we live and teach.

You noted our diversity and the emphasis we place on educating students to do the right thing. The assault last year by students against a fellow student swiftly brought the strongest possible consequences of bad behavior.
Determined to address the issue directly, we immediately called the police, dismissed the perpetrators and notified parents and alumni.
Our students live in one of the safest environments one could hope for. We will maintain a strong focus on instilling the values we believe in and continue to deal with specific issues as they arise.
RICHARD W. MUELLER Head of School Northfield Mount Hermon School Northfield, Mass., June 20, 2000
